intro: Corispermum aralocaspicum subsp. aralocaspicum, commonly known as the Aral Sea bladderwrack, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the genus Corispermum. It thrives in shallow, saline waters and is often found in the regions around the Aral Sea. Its morphology reflects adaptations to high salinity and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
